title: Software Crisis
subject: Software Engineering
theory:
Term coined in late 60s. 
Projects were running over budget, over time, and were inefficient. 
**Causes**: Hardware evolved faster than software techniques, lack of process. 
**Solution**: Introduction of Engineering discipline.

interview_questions.question: What triggered Software Crisis?
interview_questions.answer: Rapid increase in computer power and complexity of problems, with no disciplined approach to manage code.

real_world_use_cases.description: Classic example of software crisis project (delayed and costly).
